text: Dorysthenes walkeri is an Asian species of longhorn beetles in the subfamily Prioninae. No subspecies are listed in the Catalogue of Life; records of occurrence are from Iran through to Indo-China. == References == Waterhouse GR (1840) XLV. Descriptions of two new Coleopterous Insects, from the Collection of Sir Patrick Walker. Transactions of the Entomological Society of London 2 (4): 225-229, pl. XXI, figs 1, 1a-c. Gahan CJ (1906) The Fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Coleoptera. - Vol. I. (Cerambycidæ), London C. T. Bingham: xviii + 329 pp., 107 figs. White A (1853) Longicornia I. Catalogue of the coleopterous insects in the collection of the British Museum, London 7:1-174, pls. 1-4. Nonfried AF (1892) Weitere Beiträge zur Käferfauna von Südasien und Neuguinea. Berliner Entomologische Zeitschrift 36 (2) [1891]: 359-380. Gressitt JL (1951) Longicorn beetles of China, Longicornia Paris 2: 1-667, 22 pls. Özdikmen H, Ghahari H, Turgut S (2009) New records for palaearctic Cerambycidae from Iran with zoogeographical remarks (Col.: Cerambycoidea: Cerambycidae). Munis Entomology & Zoology 4 (1): 1-18, 3 figs, 5 maps. == External links == * Category:Prioninae Category:Insects of Asia
title: Dorysthenes walkeri
